sentence.Network_en: This noise will deafen us all!
sentence.Network_cn: 这种喧闹声将使我们什么也听不见!

sentence.Network_en: DEAFEN A sudden explosion deafened us for a moment.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然的爆炸声使我们耳聋了一会儿.

list.abs: 翻译词典... ... A deafening sound of gongs and drums 锣鼓喧天 Echo transmittance of sound pressure 往复透过率.

entry.tran: 震（或吵）得…听不见其他声音
entry.def: If a noise deafens you, it is so loud that you cannot hear anything else at the same time.

example.ex: The noise of the typewriters deafened her.
example.tran: 打字机的噪声吵得她什么都听不见。

entry.def: If you are deafened by something, you are made deaf by it, or are unable to hear for some time.

example.ex: He was deafened by the noise from the gun.

auth_sentence.content: Hunting horns...that almost deafen the Company.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hunting horns...that almost deafen the Company.

auth_sentence.content: Try some sciences that actually help mankind, not blind and deafen him to the truth.

auth_sentence.content: The songs I knew by heart penetrated me as I sat there trying to deafen myself.

sentences.en: A hard blow on the ear deafened him for life.
sentences.cn: 耳朵上挨的一记猛击使他耳聋了一辈子。
